verses.verse: {Job Wishes for the Old Days} d Then Job continued with his discourse:
"I wish I could go back to how things were a few months ago; when God used to watch over me,
when his lamp used to shine over my head, so I could walk through the dark,
like when I was in my prime and God trusted me with his secrets! {Lit. God's counsel was over my tent}
"The Almighty was still with me back then, and my children were still around me.
I was successful wherever I went, {Lit. When my feet were bathed in cream;} and even the rocks poured out streams of olive oil for me."
{Job Remembers His Respected Position} d "Whenever I went out to the city gate, a seat had been reserved for me in the plaza. {Lit. square ; i. e. he served as a ruling elder in his home city}
The young men would see me and withdraw, and the aged would rise and stand.
Nobles would refrain from speaking, covering their mouths with their hands.

The voices of the commanders-in-chief {Lit. Nagidim ; i. e. senior officers entrusted with dual roles of operational oversight and administrative authority} were hushed, and their tongues would cling to the roofs of their mouths."
{Job Remembers His Acts of Kindness} d "When people heard me speak, they blessed me; when people saw me, they approved me,
because I delivered the poor who were crying for help, along with orphans who had no one to help them.
Those who were about to die blessed me, and I made widows sing for joy.
I put on righteousness like clothing; my just decisions were like a robe and a turban.
I served as eyes for the blind and feet for the lame.
I was a father to the needy; I diligently inquired into the case of those I didn't know.
I broke the fangs of the wicked, and made him drop the prey."
{Job Remembers His Previous Condition} d "I used to say: Â«I will die in my home. {Lit. nest} I'm going to live as many days as there are grains of sand on the shore. {The Heb. lacks on the shore}
My roots have spread out and have found water, and dew settles at night on my branches.
My glory renews for me and my bow is as good as new in my hand.'
"They listened and waited for me, as they remained in silence for my counsel.
After I spoke, they had nothing to say, when what I said hit them.
They waited for me as one waits for rain, as one opens his mouth to drink in a spring rain shower.
I smiled at them when they had no confidence, and no one could discourage me.
I set an example of the way to live, {Lit. I chose their way} as a leader would; I lived like a king among his army; like one who comforts mourners."
